page.title: 02WATER TOWER
page.content: {The water tower in CROMWELL LANE} can be seen from miles around.It is known as the Tile Hill Water Tower and was built in 1932.It is 24m high and holds 13,060m3 of water in a single compartment.The tower is of vein forced concrete, standing on columns, between which are concrete walls with windows. access to the tank and roof is by a spiral staircase which passes in a tube through the centre of the tank. The tower is used to serve the local area with water,but its main use is to hold water at a high level (above the roofs of the houses) so that there is a good "head" of water flowing in the pipes serving Coventry. Red Lane Reservior built 1966 on West side Red Lane,Burton Green.Inside a fenced enclosure stands a reinforced concrete.Rect.semi_sunk reservoir
